result.execSummary:
The defendant William L Loftis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility.
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must have no contact with Courtney F. unless approved by Probation Agent.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

REVOKED - SENTENCED TO PRISON
Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick
11/4/15 Letter to Attorney General Schimel from victims.

Defendant William L Loftis in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Defendant William L Loftis in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CF191 & 15CM134. PSI discussed. State relates agreement. Defense relates. Defendant addresses the court.

Court relates and orders:
15CF191: Imposed and Stayed - 3 years 6 months prison. STAYED.
1 year 6 months Initial confinement.
2 years 0 months Extended supervision. 
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.

3 Years Probation - IMPOSED
180 days jail. Credit for 180 days.
Costs.
Must have no contact with Courtney F. unless approved by the probation agent.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

Must submit DNA sample and surcharge.

15CM134:
60 days jail consecutive to 15CF191 with huber and good time. 4 days sentence credit.
Costs.

Felony admonitions given.  Order for DNA given to the defendant in court.

JAIL FAXED

Defendant William L Loftis in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Defendant William L Loftis in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF190, 15CM134, 15CT98, 15CM139 & 15CF191

Agreement.  Attorney Hinde relates to date 101 days jail credit.

15CM134 - Court questions defendant.  Defendant pleads guilty to count 1 as charged.  Court accepts and finds guilty.  Count 2 - dismiss and read-in.
15CF191 - Court amends count 1 to substantial battery 940.19(2) - Class I Felony - defendant pleads guilty.  Court accepts and finds guilty of amended count 1.  Count 2 and 3 are dismissed and read-in.

15CT98 - Court dismisses and reads-in.
15CF190 - Court dismisses and reads-in.
15CM139 - Court dismisses and reads in.

Order for PSI.
Bond revoked.

Both 15CM134 & 15CF191 will be sentenced at the same time.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
